meanings.definition: Abnormal sensations, typically tingling or prickling, caused by pressure on or damage to peripheral nerves.
meanings.sent1: The paraesthesias in my fingers felt like tiny ants crawling on my skin.
meanings.sent2: She experienced paraesthesias in her feet after sitting cross-legged for too long.
meanings.sent3: The paraesthesias in my arm made it feel like a secret agent was sending Morse code messages to my brain.
meanings.sent4: The paraesthesias in her legs were like a glitch in the matrix, reminding her she was alive.
meanings.sent5: The paraesthesias were so intense, it was as if my nerves were throwing a party without me.

meanings.definition: The sensation of numbness or tingling in a person's limbs or extremities.
meanings.sent1: He described the paraesthesias in his hand as a mix of pins and needles.
meanings.sent2: After the long hike, she felt paraesthesias in her toes from the cold.
meanings.sent3: The paraesthesias in my foot were like a tiny orchestra playing a symphony of sensations.
meanings.sent4: Her paraesthesias were a warning sign, like a silent alarm going off in her body.
meanings.sent5: The paraesthesias in his fingers were so vivid, it was like fireworks going off under his skin.
